You’ll need 4 more billiard balls, arranged so that, from the top, it looks like a “plus” when stationary; (i.e. you can have forces in the x-, and y-axes - parallel to the table surface - going at once), and - of course - you’ll have to modify the frame. The ball at the center (the yellow one) will remain, but now you’ll have two more balls on either side perpendicular to the line from the red ball to the blue one. Hint:use the stripey balls for this, and use a cue ball or the 8-ball, as the center ball, instead. Does this lead to an even wilder swinging motion, or does it tend to dampen the swinging motion? What happens if you spray the billiard balls with a light misting of water? Hairspray? WD-40?
